comment: Be prepared for a good bit of homework, though she makes the topic fun and entertaining. For the most part, it was easy to know what she expected of us and communicated her wants pretty well. There were some tedious assignments, though she mostly graded fairly. Expect weekly readings/watches to coincide with the week's homework.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Gives good feedback--Lots of homework

comment: She was very kind and responded to her emails quickly, but she DOES NOT accept late work.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Gives good feedback

comment: This course is pretty heavy, but it's very manageable. There are two bgig essays that she gives you time to do. Voicethreads aren't bad, and the Perusall activities aren't bad at all, either. The texts aren't given to you, so you must find them alone. I liked the class people complaining about the work who don't listen to them.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--So many papers

comment: stay away.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--So many papers

comment: As long as you do the Voicethreads, Perusall readings, and assignments, you'll be fine—they're not the most difficult things in the world. Everything is super organized by module, and each module has a checklist to follow, which makes it easy to stay on track.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: The professor was okay, but she does give a lot of work each week along with lots of reading from textbooks you have to buy as the school doesn't provide them (The books aren't school textbooks). Four major essay one in which you have to complete during thanksgiving break.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Lots of homework

comment: Feels like a never ending cycle of essays each week, hardest course I've taken in my life, wouldn't take again even if I was paid a million dollars. Very strict grader
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--So many papers

comment: The class had Perusal,VoiceThread,and D2L assignments, two essays,and a project. Despite not being difficult, the workload felt excessive for a gen ed course. VoiceThread videos over three minutes and required interactions with classmates defeats the purpose of online flexibility, making the course feel more like busywork than independent learning
rating_tags: Tough grader--Participation matters

comment: She is not a bad professor but I would not say a good one either. She is just in the middle. The grading criteria is there but there always seems to be something she wants you to write but is unclear. I feel it was more a teach yourself class and I did not enjoy this aspect of it. It made understanding the material extremely difficult.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: Dr. Batchelder is awesome! The assignments and topics she covers are all very engaging and she makes the class so fun! Attendance is mandatory and the major assignments are essays. All of her instructions are very easy to understand and she gives great feedback!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Group projects--Gives good feedback

comment: Amazing professor, response fast through emails. Had her for online and the course is only 7 week long. There was a total of 3 essays, She gives out clear instructions and she is easy to communicate with. The class moves very fast so plan ahead. And you wont get a lot of feedback from the essay. There's also only one extra credit opportunity.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Respected

comment: She was nice but a very harsh grader, she also takes participation very seriously... so make sure you talk as much as possible.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Participation matters--Accessible outside class

comment: Great professor who really cares about the success of her students and is very accessible. If you put in the effort you will do great in this class, however there are a lot of readings.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: She was really nice. The course is designed around writing a research paper for one topic. There are smaller papers to get to the big paper. There isn't an overload of extra assignments, everything has something to do with helping you to write the final paper. She is really nice about answering questions through emails. Really great professor!
rating_tags: Caring

comment: Get ready to write. The textbook is very helpful to her assignments but her instructions weren't clear. Make sure you choose a topic you have a lot of writing material for because it will be that subject all semester. Being on your phone offends her. She wasn't my first choice I did get put into her class but it wasn't awful. Just Not for me.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--So many papers

comment: She is a caring professor but I took her 7 week course and it was tough. One of the first classes I have somewhat struggled with. LOTS of assignments weekly and unclear directions. She will email you back quickly but does not communicate exactly what she expects. Very tough grader and will take off points for small things that she did not specify.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: Professor B. was excellent! I took her online 7-week course. It was a lot of work, but so worth it. She is so helpful if you reach out to her and she always leads you on the right path for her assignments. 3 papers, and lots of discussions, so be prepared to read all required material. Overall- amazing!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: Great Professor! Took her class online for the seven-week course! You had about 5-6 assignments to complete each week, but you had plenty of time to do them. She only gave us 3 papers to do, and they were challenging but easy. Fast pace. Great communicator, also if you emailed her for better understanding with assignments, she explained it better.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Dr. B was an amazing professor, I took her class online for the seven-week course! You had about 5-6 assignments to complete, but you had plenty of time to do them. She only gave us 3 papers to do, and they were challenging but easy. The class moves fast! It is most definitely worth taking the 7-week course.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: She is a very good professer, I took the 7- week 1102 class online. It was a shorter class so it was a lot of work. She explains everything so well and makes the work very simple and easy to follow. There were about 5 assignments each week but they were not impossible. Hard class but if you do the work you will be successful, def reccomend
rating_tags: Participation matters--Gives good feedback--Lots of homework

comment: Took Dr B for 1001 and came back for 1002. Still super awesome and understanding, talking to her after class about ideas helped a lot and she was super supportive the whole way. The class was structured around writing a research paper, each assignment was an element relating to it, with the final being a non-essay project using what you researched.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read

comment: I took this class Fall 2020 online. Dr. B was really helpful and consistently tried to help lead students to understanding what she wanted for the essays using examples. The class was built around writing 3-4 essays, and each essay used skills learned from the prior one. She was very understanding, emailing her with any issues always helped a lot.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: If youre not an English person, this is the class for you. Shes very nice and cares about her students. Theres 3 big essays, but the prompts are very engaging. With the books she gave us to read, I read bits and pieces and still would get Bs on assignments. I took her 7 week english 1101 which is VERY FAST, but if you have the time it is worth.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Caring--Get ready to read

comment: class was fine. lost 10 points in participation for not going to the writing center.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--So many papers

comment: I took Dr. Batchelder for an online English class and she was great. The workload was modest and with the essay projects, she was very specific about what she expected, made videos explaining what she expected, and had us do peer review activities to get the chance to fix our papers. 10/10 definitely recommend Dr. Batchelder.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: great professor. i recommend. very organized and not too much work. just a couple papers a semester. Fairly easy
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Caring--So many papers

comment: Dr. B is amazing!! She made everything fun and interesting, and the class was very well organized. Dont expect to get by without doing your work though. Theres only 4 essays all semester, so if you work pace yourself youll be good. Definitely recommend taking her!!!!
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Clear grading criteria--Caring
